intro: Bomarea endotrachys, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and possesses heart-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
